column1: Narrator : The island is huge and a tall column of smoke is rising from its shore.
PlayerSpeak : There's nothing to do here.
Narrator : A castaway is standing on the shore. He waves at CAPITAINE as they approach.
column2: Narrator : A small child is sitting on the shore, skin n’ bones.
column4: OtherSpeak : I beg you, leave me alone! I have NOTHING to give you.

column2: OtherSpeak : I’ve been abandoned on this island…

column1: OtherSpeak : Three years I’ve been stranded on this island!
column2: OtherSpeak : My parents didn’t like my behavior.

column1: OtherSpeak : Take me with you, I beg you!

column17: Choice : We have places to be lads! Anchors aweigh! (leave)

column2: Choice : Give us everything or you’re done! (attack)
column4: Choice : Sorry pal’, no room on board.
column9: OtherSpeak : Give me at least something to sink my teeth into! Please!
column15: OtherSpeak : I'm afraid of storms and travelling on a big boat like this.
OtherSpeak : I need something soft and cuddly to hold onto.

column2: OtherSpeak : But... I told you I've been stranded here... I have NOTHING of value!
column11: Choice : Ye keep eating coconuts alright? They be good for your health.
column15: OtherSpeak : I’ll only join if you have a teddy bear on board.

column5: OtherSpeak : Of course I do, the crew of mad lads who sunk me were asking for it !
column6: OtherSpeak : I’m stranded here ! I know nothing about anything out of this island.

column17: Choice : We have places to be lads! Anchors aweigh! (leave)

column2: OtherSpeak : So you’re looking for NOMTRESOR, ey…

column5: OtherSpeak : If I know something about NOMTRESOR ?!
column16: OtherSpeak : By the way, while waiting:

column2: OtherSpeak : It’s a linked to an ancient magic, and so forget about logic looking for it.
column5: OtherSpeak : How did you think I got myself in this situation.
column16: OtherSpeak : I made this pasta necklace, I want you to have it!

column2: OtherSpeak : It’s only magical scrolls, formulas and spells.
column5: OtherSpeak : Only deranged sailors looking for the treasure manage to get their ship sunk.

column2: OtherSpeak : Thing is, I stumbled into one of them.
column5: OtherSpeak : The crew I was part of were on the treasure trail since forever.

column2: OtherSpeak : All right let’s get on the ship and start looking again !!!!

column5: OtherSpeak : Why did you ask then ?!
column6: OtherSpeak : Hang on a minute there.
OtherSpeak : If you think I’m gonna tell you and sail about
OtherSpeak : I’m only telling you if you let me search it with you.

column1: Choice : Buddy, you’re in luck, we’re leaving

column8: Narrator : Behind a rock, some an immense stack of papers is hidden. Years of childish doodles, nonsense stream of thoughts.

column6: PlayerSpeak : Nothing to sink my teeth into.
column8: Narrator : The interesting thing, though, is that half of those papers are blackened with two words.

column2: Choice : Let’s set camp here. We’ll sleep NEXTTIME (sleep)
Narrator : The boat is anchored on the shore. The morning air is refreshing and light.
